column5: BRUSSELS The European Commission on Thursday approved Teva Pharmaceutical Industries'  $40.5 billion acquisition of the generics activities of Allergan  conditional on a number of divestments  notably Allergan businesses in Britain and Ireland.

column4: EU approves Teva bid for Allergan's generics with conditions
column5: BRUSSELS  March 10 The European Commission on Thursday approved Teva Pharmaceutical Industries'  $40.5 billion acquisition of the generics activities of Allergan  conditional on a number of divestments  notably Allergan businesses in Britain and Ireland.

column4: Teva acquisition inches closer  and so do bonds
column5: LONDON  March 10 (IFR) - Teva expects to win EU antitrust approval for its US$40.5bn acquisition of Allergan  paving the way for a jumbo US$22bn multi-currency bond issue in the second quarter of 2016  several sources told IFR.

column4: TransCanada in talks to buy Columbia Pipeline Group - WSJ
column5: March 10 TransCanada Corp is in talks to buy Columbia Pipeline Group Inc  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 3-United Tech looks for a big deal after rebuffing Honeywell
column5: NEW YORK  March 10 United Technologies Corp   maker of jet engines  aircraft components and building systems  said it is open to doing a large acquisition despite rejecting a merger proposed by Honeywell International Inc .

column4: United Technologies aerospace says 'we're ready for an acquisition'
column5: NEW YORK United Technologies Corp  said on Thursday that its aerospace parts business is open to making a large acquisition as well as smaller deals that fill in its product lines.

column4: United Technologies aerospace says 'we're ready for an acquisition'
column5: NEW YORK  March 10 United Technologies Corp  said on Thursday that its aerospace parts business is open to making a large acquisition as well as smaller deals that fill in its product lines.

column4: BRIEF-United Tech reaffirms 2016 and Q1 guidance
column5: * Says reaffirms 2016 outlook for adjusted eps of $6.30 to $6.60

column4: U.S. panel asks Valeant to justify withholding documents
column5: A U.S. congressional committee stepped up the pressure on Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc   on Thursday  urging the company to explain why it was withholding documents related to an investigation into drug pricing.

column4: Westar Energy exploring strategic options including sale - Bloomberg
column5: March 10 Westar Energy Inc  Kansas' biggest power company  is in early stages of exploring strategic options including a sale  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 1-Whiting Petroleum sees more than $1 bln in credit line cuts
column5: DENVER  March 10 Whiting Petroleum Corp  expects its credit line to be cut by more than $1 billion in an early May loan review  Chief Executive Jim Volker said on Thursday  the latest industry fallout from low oil prices crimping margins and fueling massive spending cuts.

column4: Whiting expects more than $1 billion in credit line cuts
column5: DENVER  March 10 Whiting Petroleum Corp  expects its credit line to be cut by more than $1 billion in an early May borrowing base redetermination  the latest industry fallout from low oil prices  Chief Executive Jim Volker said on Thursday.

column4: ETE makes private offering to help pay for Williams deal
column5: NEW YORK Energy Transfer Equity   which is in the process of buying rival pipeline company Williams Companies Inc   said it carried out a private offering of convertible shares to some of its investors in order to help pay for the deal.

column4: Taco Bell launches $1 breakfast menu
column5: Yum Brands Inc  owned Taco Bell upped the ante in the breakfast wars  launching a nationwide $1 breakfast menu in a bid to compete with other fast-food chains that are cashing in on the trend.

column4: Taco Bell launches $1 breakfast menu
